data.name: tokudb_alter_print_error
data.type: print errors for alter table operations.

data.type: time in seconds that

data.name: tokudb_block_size
data.type: uncompressed size of internal fractal tree and leaf nodes. changing will only affect tables created after the new setting is in effect. existing tables will keep the setting they were created with unless the table is dumped and reloaded.

data.name: tokudb_bulk_fetch
data.type: if set to

data.name: tokudb_cache_size
data.type: size in bytes of the tokudb cache. this variable is read-only and cannot be changed dynamically. to change the value, either set the value in the

data.name: tokudb_check_jemalloc
data.type: check if jemalloc is linked.

data.name: tokudb_checkpoint_lock
data.type: mechanism to lock out tokudb checkpoints. when set to

data.name: tokudb_checkpoint_on_flush_logs
data.type: tokudb checkpoint on flush logs.

data.name: tokudb_checkpointing_period
data.type: time in seconds between the beginning of each checkpoint. it is recommended to leave this at the default setting of 1 minute.

data.name: tokudb_cleaner_iterations
data.type: number of internal nodes processed in each cleaner thread period (see

data.name: tokudb_cleaner_period
data.type: frequency in seconds for the running of the cleaner thread. setting to

data.name: tokudb_commit_sync
data.type: whether or not the transaction log is flushed upon transaction commit. flushing has a minor performance penalty, but switching it off means that committed transactions may not survive a server crash.

data.name: tokudb_create_index_online
data.type: whether indexes are hot or not. hot, or online, indexes (the default) mean that the table is available for inserting and updates while the index is being created. it is slower to create hot indexes.

data.name: tokudb_data_dir
data.type: directory where the tokudb data is stored. by default the variable is empty, in which case the regular

data.name: tokudb_debug
data.type: setting to a non-zero value turns on various tokudb debug traces.

data.name: tokudb_directio
data.type: when set to on, tokudb writes use direct io instead of buffered io.

data.name: tokudb_disable_hot_alter
data.type: if set to

data.name: tokudb_disable_prefetching
data.type: if prefetching is not disabled (the default), range queries usually benefit from aggressive prefetching of blocks of rows. for range queries with limit clauses, this can create unnecessary io, and so prefetching can be disabled if these make up a majority of range queries.

data.name: tokudb_disable_slow_alter
data.type: usually, tokudb permits column addition, deletion, expansion, and renaming with minimal locking, very quickly. this variable determines whether certain slow [alter|alter]] table statements that cannot take advantage of this feature are permitted. statements that are slow are those that include a mix of column additions, deletions or expansions, for example,

data.name: tokudb_empty_scan
data.type: tokudb algorithm to check if the table is empty when opened. setting to

data.name: tokudb_fs_reserve_percent
data.type: if this percentage of the filesystem is not free, inserts will be prohibited. recommended value is half the size of the available memory. once disabled, inserts will be re-enabled once twice the reserve is available. tokudb will freeze entirely if the disk becomes entirely full.

data.name: tokudb_fsync_log_period
data.type: fsync() operations frequency in milliseconds. if set to

data.name: tokudb_hide_default_row_format
data.type: hide the default row format.

data.name: tokudb_killed_time
data.type: control lock tree kill callback frequency.

data.name: tokudb_last_lock_timeout
data.type: empty by default, when a lock deadlock is detected, or a lock request times out, set to a json document describing the most recent lock conflict. only set when the first bit of

data.name: tokudb_load_save_space
data.type: if set to

data.name: tokudb_loader_memory_size
data.type: memory limit for each loader instance used by the tokudb bulk loader.  memory is taken from the tokudb cache (

data.name: tokudb_lock_timeout
data.type: time in milliseconds that a transaction will wait for a lock held by another transaction to be released before timing out with a

data.name: tokudb_lock_timeout_debug
data.type: when bit zero is set (default

data.name: tokudb_log_dir
data.type: directory where the tokudb log files are stored. by default the variable is empty, in which case the regular

data.name: tokudb_max_lock_memory
data.type: max memory for locks.

data.name: tokudb_optimize_index_fraction
data.type: when deleting a percentage of the tree (useful when the left side of the tree has many deletions, such as a pattern with increasing ids or dates), it's possible to optimize a subset of the fractal tree, as determined by the value of this variable, which ranges from

data.name: tokudb_optimize_index_name
data.type: if set to an index name, will optimize that single index in a table. empty by default.

data.name: tokudb_optimize_throttle
data.type: table optimization utilizes all available resources by default. this variable allows the table optimization speed to be limited in order to reduce the overall resources used. the limit places an upper bound on the number of fractal tree leaf nodes that are optimized per second.

data.name: tokudb_pk_insert_mode
data.type: mode for primary key inserts using either

data.name: tokudb_prelock_empty
data.type: if set to

data.name: tokudb_read_block_size
data.type: uncompressed size in bytes of the read blocks of the fractal tree leaves. changing will only affect tables created after the new setting is in effect. existing tables will keep the setting they were created with unless the table is dumped and reloaded. larger values are better for large range scans and higher compressions, while smaller values are better for point and small range scans.

data.name: tokudb_read_buf_size
data.type: per-client size in bytes of the buffer used for storing bulk fetched values as part of a large range query. reduce if there are many simultaneous clients. setting to

data.name: tokudb_read_status_frequency
data.type: progress is measured every this many reads for display by

data.name: tokudb_row_format
data.type: compression algorithm used by default to compress data. can be overridden by a row format specified in the

data.name: tokudb_rpl_check_readonly
data.type: by default, when the slave is in read only mode, row events will be run from the binary log using tokudb's read-free replication (rfr). setting this variable to

data.name: tokudb_rpl_lookup_rows
data.type: if set to

data.name: tokudb_rpl_lookup_rows_delay
data.type: can be used to simulate long disk reads by sleeping for the specified time, in microseconds, before the row lookup query. only useful to change in a test environment.

data.name: tokudb_rpl_unique_checks
data.type: if set to

data.name: tokudb_rpl_unique_checks_delay
data.type: can be used to simulate long disk reads by sleeping for the specified time, in microseconds, before the row lookup query. only useful to change in a test environment.

data.name: tokudb_support_xa
data.type: whether or not the prepare phase of an xa transaction performs an fsync().

data.name: tokudb_tmp_dir
data.type: directory where the tokudb bulk loaders temporary files are stored. can be very large, and useful to place on a separate disk. by default the variable is empty, in which case the regular

data.name: tokudb_version
data.type: the tokudb version of the plugin included on mariadb.

data.name: tokudb_write_status_frequency
data.type: progress is measured every this many writes for display by
